alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 3:08PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cherry, northwestern Brown and western Keya Paha Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 308 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Valentine, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Norden, Wood Lake, Smith Falls State Park, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Antelope Peak, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River, Meadville, North River Trail and Sparks. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 193 and 224. Highway 97 between mile markers 134 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 197 and 219. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
